On behalf of a proud and grateful nation and all of the constituents of California’s 27th congressional district, I was honored today to attend Deputy Ryan Clinkunbroomer‘s funeral in downtown Los Angeles and present his parents, Mike and Kim, and fiancé, Brittany, with flags flown over our nation’s capital. 

Today, Deputy Clinkunbroomer sits by the Lord and looks over all of us with joy. We all must do more to support our law enforcement officers on a daily basis as they look over us during this lifetime.

There is a national security and humanitarian crisis at our southern border. It’s hurting our country, and it’s the direct result of this administration’s weak border policies.

The White House is finally coming to terms with that reality. But it may be too late.

Funding our own government should not be conditional on funding Ukraine. 

The House appropriations bills and their underlying policies are going to save this country. They will secure our OWN border, effectively curb record high inflation, and bolster our deterrence against the CCP.

Matt Gaetz trying to get rid of Speaker McCarthy is like rooting for the iceberg when you’re standing on the Titanic.

The American people expect the Republican majority to govern and protect them from this administration. We need to cut spending, fight inflation, defend against the CCP threat and secure the border.

Now let’s stop the drama and get to work to pass our appropriations bills with great policies in them.

The House just passed a short-term spending bill that will keep the government open and keep our troops paid.

Now we can continue our appropriations work to make spending cuts, fight inflation, and secure our border. Watch here ⬇️

Now House Dems are refusing to support a short-term spending bill to keep the government open because it doesn’t include funding for Ukraine.

Funding for our own government and our own troops shouldn’t be contingent on funding for another government and their troops. This is plain wrong!

Right now, House Democrats are asking for Congress to adjourn with LESS THAN 12 HOURS until a government shutdown.

I can’t believe I have to say this, but Congress needs to stay right here, do our job, cut spending, secure our border, pay our troops and pass conservative spending bills!

The short-term spending bill that Congress voted on today would have kept the government open, secured the border, and cut spending.

Unfortunately, 21 of my Republican colleagues joined House Democrats to effectively shut down the government.

Here's why they're wrong ⬇️

.@POTUS threatened to VETO the defense spending bill because of my 30% PAY RAISE for our troops.

Now he wants to pay Ukrainian soldiers during a potential shutdown when our own soldiers would go unpaid.

I cosponsored the Pay Our Troops Act to right this wrong and make sure our men and women in uniform don't miss a paycheck.

September has been the least affordable month for U.S. housing in the past century when you account for mortgage rates, incomes, and housing prices. 

And it didn’t happen overnight or by accident. It’s the result of unprecedented spending and historically painful inflation.

This is why we need to aggressively cut federal spending.

President Biden wants to veto a historic 30% pay raise for our junior enlisted troops.

My military pay raise gets our servicemembers off food stamps and above the poverty line. Biden’s rationale for this veto threat is unfounded, short-sighted, and dangerous. @WhiteHouse @SecDef

Here’s my message to the 916,000 servicemembers and their families affected by this pay raise:

Our conference will ultimately figure this out, and we’re going to win this. Because this isn’t us versus the Democrats. This isn’t left versus right. 

This is about our country’s security, and about America keeping pace with a very real bear right outside of our tent in the form of China.

The Republican defense spending bill is the strongest conservative national security and anti-China legislation in recent history.

Any vote against this bill was a vote in opposition to our troops and in favor of the CCP.

We need to fund our military and support our troops.

The message I sent alongside my fellow veterans in Congress was simple and all-important: Stop the political gamesmanship.

Our men and women in uniform are too important to be used as bargaining chips. We can’t afford to hand wins to China.

House Republicans are the only defense against President Biden driving our military into the ground.

I'm holding a press conference w/ fellow veterans in Congress to make this clear: We need to stop the political gamesmanship & fund our troops.

Tune in: https://https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1lDxLPveDQyxm

To my fellow Republicans voting against a rule to prevent the most conservative DOD bill in decades from coming to the floor for debate: You are aiding the extension of Biden’s dangerous policies and further handicapping us against China.

This is more than a procedural vote. If you have issues with the bill, let’s debate them and amend it on the floor.

Our troops are depending on Republicans as the last line of defense. They will take this personally. I take this personally.

Atmospheric rivers caused major flooding this past winter in #CA27, especially in Lake Hughes, wiping out roads and damaging homes and property in our communities. Today, I introduced the Improving Atmospheric River Forecasts Act, legislation that would lead to better atmospheric river forecasting to mitigate the loss of life and property.

Additionally, better forecasting will allow us to capture more water from atmospheric river events to help vulnerable communities withstand the dry season. This legislation will equip us with the tools to fortify our communities against severe weather and better utilize the precipitation to insulate those same communities against drought; a win-win for California.

Read more here: mikegarcia.house.gov/news/do…

Today on #MilitarySpouseAppreciationDay, I joined @NorahODonnell and my friend and Democrat colleague @RepCarbajal to discuss our bill, the Military Spouse Licensing Relief Act, which was signed into law earlier this year - a BIG win for our military spouses and families.

Our military spouses make constant sacrifices to support our men and women in uniform. On #MilitarySpouseAppreciationDay, I’d like to honor our military spouses for their service to our nation. I’ve led in Congress on all fronts to improve the quality of life for these heroes and the Military Spouse Licensing Relief Act that I introduced is now law. This is one of the biggest pieces of legislation in support of active duty spouses in history.

Military spouse unemployment rates have been around 22% for decades. This law grants military spouses professional license reciprocity when moving to a new location on orders - for example, teachers, nurses, cosmetologists, etc. By allowing this license reciprocity, military families can remain dual-income households upon relocation. I’m committed to the fight in Congress to improve the quality of life for our military families.

The IRS got the best deal from the Inflation Reinforcement Act last August: $80 billion in additional funding. The Prioritizing Troops over Tax Collectors Act will rescind that funding and reallocate it to give our junior enlisted servicemembers a much-needed pay raise.

This bill will remove the unfair SALT deduction cap & allow for taxpayers in states like CA to deduct more from their federal taxes. At a time when families in #CA27 are choosing between whether to fill up their car w/ gas or buy groceries, this will help alleviate such burdens.

The Inflation Prevention Act will equip Congress with a necessary tool to fight inflation caused by the federal government’s reckless spending habits. Congress must do all it can to fight inflation, and this bill will do just that!

Tonight, I introduced my first 3 bills in the 118th Congress. These bills address some of our nation’s most pressing issues: Inflation & the cost of living, rescinding the IRS’ additional $80B, and providing our servicemembers with a pay raise.
